https://prez.dev/description.@value: The status of this register entry
The subject is an instance of a class.
The property that identifies the version IRI of an ontology.
A set of concepts, optionally including statements about semantic relationships between those concepts
A statement or formal explanation of the meaning of a concept
Relates, by convention, a concept scheme to a concept which is topmost in the broader/narrower concept hierarchies for that scheme, providing an entry point to these hierarchies
A note about the past state/use/meaning of a concept
The preferred lexical label for a resource, in a given language
If this Entity prov:wasAttributedTo Agent :ag, then it can qualify how it was influenced using prov:qualifiedAttribution [ a prov:Attribution;  prov:agent :ag; :foo :bar ].

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: The stage of a borehole in relation to the lifecycle of the borehole, from proposal and operational stages through to completion and rehabilitation, and with a focus on terminology as applied in the Geological Survey of Western Australia (GSWA) databases. The vocabulary focuses on standard terminology from the energy and mineral resources sectors, highlighting instances where the same term carries different meaning in different fields. In the context of this vocabulary, the term fluid energy refers to sources such as gas, petroleum and geothermal, as covered by the Petroleum Legislation Amendment Act 2024, and is exclusive of mineral sources of energy (e.g. coal, uranium). Note that the currency of borehole status data in GSWA's databases is time-stamped, reflecting information gathered from a borehole operator’s well completion report or from a responsible regulatory authority at a specific point in time; subsequent changes are unlikely to be recorded.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value: This vocabulary combines terminology from the energy and mineral resources industries, with a structure based on the main phases of drilling operations: planning and approval, operational, operations suspended, and post-operational. It is largely based and expands on the 2021 Geoscience Australia (GA) listing (https://db-content.ga.gov.au/data_dictionary/Borehole_Status_vocabulary_2021.pdf, later published at https://pid.geoscience.gov.au/def/voc/ga/BoreholeStatus), "an amalgam of terms used by professional bodies (e.g. PPDM, CoalLog) and regulatory authorities. Some of the terminology used across these professional domains and jurisdictions has varied over time, and in some cases the same term has a different meaning for different types of boreholes. GA has endeavoured to merge these sources of terminology into a consistent classification that applies for all borehole types." As GA's list stemmed largely from the energy sector, GSWA has expanded the vocabulary to cover mineral resources industry terminology, in relation to both drilling and rehabilitation stages. The Geological Survey of Queensland (GSQ) Borehole Status (http://linked.data.gov.au/def/borehole-status) and Borehole Status Event (http://linked.data.gov.au/def/borehole-status-event) vocabularies were also consulted. A draft of the GSWA's vocabulary was shared with the Government Geoscience Information Committee (GGIC) Petroleum Data Working Group, leading to the adoption of concepts from this vocabulary by GSQ (particularly for post-operational stages) and a more consistent approach nationally.

https://prez.dev/description.@value: The stage of a borehole in relation to the lifecycle of the borehole, from proposal and operational stages through to completion and rehabilitation, and with a focus on terminology as applied in the Geological Survey of Western Australia (GSWA) databases. The vocabulary focuses on standard terminology from the energy and mineral resources sectors, highlighting instances where the same term carries different meaning in different fields. In the context of this vocabulary, the term fluid energy refers to sources such as gas, petroleum and geothermal, as covered by the Petroleum Legislation Amendment Act 2024, and is exclusive of mineral sources of energy (e.g. coal, uranium). Note that the currency of borehole status data in GSWA's databases is time-stamped, reflecting information gathered from a borehole operator’s well completion report or from a responsible regulatory authority at a specific point in time; subsequent changes are unlikely to be recorded.
An entry that is seen as having a reasonable measure of stability, may be used to mark the full adoption of a previously 'experimental' entry.
A profile for SKOS Concept Schemes
The creator/author of this CreativeWork. This is the same as the Author property for CreativeWork
The date on which the CreativeWork was created or the item was added to a DataFeed
The date on which the CreativeWork was most recently modified or when the item's entry was modified within a DataFeed
Keywords or tags used to describe some item. Multiple textual entries in a keywords list are typically delimited by commas, or by repeating the property
The publisher of the creative work
The version of the CreativeWork embodied by a specified resource
